html: In the same way the ancient Israelites expiated their sin of worshiping the Golden Calf by grinding it to powder (Exodus 32:17-20), so the sin of idolatry of Jehovah’s end-time people is “expiated” by their removing all vestiges of idols. Hurtful conditions such as the land’s takeover by animals and desiccation of its foliage are seldom perceived as Jehovah’s covenant curses by the wicked, who are interested only in filling their immediate needs. Because by their idolatry they have become “an undiscerning people,” they come under Jehovah’s law of justice, not of mercy (Isaiah 1:3; 42:17-25; 56:10).
